style.name: AddRec_DTB_Parent
style.description: These settings govern the generation and display of the master (parent) record panel.

option.name: FieldsLayout
option.description: Specifies the basic field layout within the panel.

option.name: PanelFieldOrder
option.description: Specifies the field ordering within the panel.

option.name: PanelFieldDirection
option.description: Specifies the direction in which fields are placed in the panel.

option.name: PanelHeading
option.description: Places a title heading above the panel.

option.name: ExpandCollapse
option.description: Place an 'Expand and Collapse' toggle button on the panel.

option.name: PanelStyle
option.description: Specifies field label placement relative to their associated fields.

optiongroup.name: PageButtons
optiongroup.description: Add these buttons to the page.

option.name: SaveAndNewButton
option.description: Place a 'Save and New' button in Add Record page. Allows users to enter multiple records without leaving the page.

style.name: AddRec_DTB_Child
style.description: These settings govern the generation and display of the detail (child) table panels.

option.name: ModernLabelsInRepeaters
option.description: Classic Columnar Grid panels display one field per column and expand horizontally to fit the number of fields displayed. Modern Fixed Width panels maintain a fixed page width regardless of number of fields displayed

option.name: TableFieldsLayout
option.description: Specifies the basic field layout within the table panel. Applies to Modern Page Styles only.

option.name: PanelFieldOrder
option.description: Specifies the field ordering within the panel.

option.name: PanelHeading
option.description: Places a title heading above the panel.

option.name: ExpandCollapse
option.description: Place an 'Expand and Collapse Toggle' button on the panel.

option.name: ColumnHeadings
option.description: Adds a field label for each field value (for Classic Page Styles, labels are always above the table grid. Modern labels can be either inside or above).

option.name: PaginationControl
option.description: Places pagination control on the panel.

option.name: PageSize
option.description: The number of rows displayed on-screen at one time in a Table panel. Use the Pagination control to move from page to page. Use the PageSize pass-through attribute in the Properties dialog to set individual controls.

option.name: PanelStyle
option.description: Enable scrolling in the data grid portion of the panel.

option.name: ColumnSorting
option.description: Enable column sorting for all appropriate columns in the panel.

option.name: LinkForeignKey
option.displayname: Automatically link foreign key field to
option.description: Creates hypertext links for foreign key fields in the panel. Allows users to click through to the underlying record.

option.name: HideDataUntilSearched
option.description: Initially hides data display. Displays data when user clicks 'Go'. Use the HideDataUntilSearched pass-through attribute in the Properties dialog to set individual controls.

option.name: InitialRowDisplayStyle
option.description: Specifies the initial panel layout when the page is first displayed. Use the InitialRowDisplay pass-through attribute in the Properties dialog to set individual controls.

option.name: RowDisplayAction
option.description: Specifies how to handle expanding and collapsing table rows when the ‘Expand’ button is clicked. Use the RowDisplayAction pass-through attribute in the Properties dialog to set individual controls.

optionitem.displayname: Expand selected row and collapse other rows

optiongroup.name: Filters
optiongroup.description: These settings govern the generation and display of data filters.

option.name: FieldFilters
option.description: Add up to two filters on the panel. Above Table and Above Column apply to Classic Page Styles only.

option.name: SearchControl
option.description: Add a search control on the panel.

optiongroup.name: TableButtons
optiongroup.description: Add these buttons to Show Table panels.

option.name: AddButton
option.description: Places an 'Add Record' button in the panel's tool bar.

option.name: DeleteButton
option.description: Places a 'Delete Record' button in the panel's tool bar. This button is generated only if a primary key or virtual primary key is present.

option.name: ResetButton
option.description: Places a 'Reset filters' button in the panel's tool bar.

optiongroup.name: TableRowButtons
optiongroup.description: Add these buttons to each table row.

option.name: RowDeleteButton
option.description: Places a 'Delete Record' button in each table row. This button is generated only if a primary key or virtual primary key is present.

option.name: RowSelectionCheckbox
option.description: Places a checkbox control in each table row.

option.description: Specifies the basic field layout within the table panel. Applies to Modern Page Styles only.

option.name: PanelFieldOrder
option.description: Specifies the field ordering within the panel.

option.name: PanelHeading
option.description: Places a title heading above the panel.

option.name: ExpandCollapse
option.description: Place an 'Expand and Collapse Toggle' button on the panel.

option.name: ColumnHeadings
option.description: Adds a field label for each field value (for Classic Page Styles, labels are always above the table grid. Modern labels can be either inside or above).

option.name: PaginationControl
option.description: Places pagination control on the panel.

option.name: PageSize
option.description: The number of rows displayed on-screen at one time in a Table panel. Use the Pagination control to move from page to page. Use the PageSize pass-through attribute in the Properties dialog to set individual controls.

option.name: PanelStyle
option.description: Enable scrolling in the data grid portion of the panel.

option.name: ColumnSorting
option.description: Enable column sorting for all appropriate columns in the panel.

option.name: HideDataUntilSearched
option.description: Initially hides data display. Displays data when user clicks 'Go'. Use the HideDataUntilSearched pass-through attribute in the Properties dialog to set individual controls.

option.name: InitialRowDisplayStyle
option.description: Specifies the initial panel layout when the page is first displayed. Use the InitialRowDisplay pass-through attribute in the Properties dialog to set individual controls.

option.name: RowDisplayAction
option.description: Specifies how to handle expanding and collapsing table rows when the ‘Expand’ button is clicked. Use the RowDisplayAction pass-through attribute in the Properties dialog to set individual controls.

optionitem.displayname: Expand selected row and collapse other rows

optiongroup.name: Filters
optiongroup.description: These settings govern the generation and display of data filters.

option.name: FieldFilters
option.description: Add up to two filters on the panel. Above Table and Above Column apply to Classic Page Styles only.

option.description: Add a search control on the panel.

option.description: Places pagination control on the panel.

option.name: PageSize
option.description: The number of rows displayed on-screen at one time in a Table panel. Use the Pagination control to move from page to page. Use the PageSize pass-through attribute in the Properties dialog to set individual controls.

option.description: Enable scrolling in the data grid portion of the panel.

option.name: WordButton
option.description: Places a 'Word Report' button in the panel's tool bar. The human-readable Microsoft Word Document Format file can be emailed.

option.name: ExportExcelButton
option.description: Places an 'Export to Excel' button in the panel's tool bar. The exported XML file can be read directly by Microsoft Excel.

option.name: ExportButton
option.description: Places an 'Export to CSV' button in the panel's tool bar. The exported Comma Separated Value (CSV) file can be imported into a variety of applications.

option.name: ImportButton
option.description: Places an 'Import data' button in the panel's tool bar. The Data Import Wizard imports an ASCII comma separated value file.

option.name: RefreshButton
option.description: Places a 'Refresh data' button in the panel's tool bar.

option.name: ResetButton
option.description: Places a 'Reset filters' button in the panel's tool bar.

optiongroup.name: TableRowButtons
optiongroup.description: Add these buttons to each table row.

option.name: RowViewButton
option.description: Places a 'Show Record' button in each table row. This button is generated only if a primary key or virtual primary key is present.

option.name: RowEditButton
option.description: Places an 'Edit Record' button in each table row. This button is generated only if a primary key or virtual primary key is present.

option.name: RowCopyButton
option.description: Places a 'Copy Record' button in in each table row. This button is generated only if a primary key or virtual primary key is present.

option.name: RowDeleteButton
option.description: Places a 'Delete Record' button in each table row. This button is generated only if a primary key or virtual primary key is present.

option.name: RowSelectionCheckbox
option.description: Places a checkbox control in each table row.

style.name: WebReport
style.description: These settings govern the generation and display of the table panel.

option.name: ModernLabelsInRepeaters
option.description: Classic Columnar Grid panels display one field per column and expand horizontally to fit the number of fields displayed. Modern Fixed Width panels maintain a fixed page width regardless of number of fields displayed

option.name: TableFieldsLayout
option.description: Specifies the basic field layout within the table panel. Applies to Modern Page Styles only.

option.name: PanelFieldOrder
option.description: Specifies the field ordering within the panel.

option.name: PanelHeading
option.description: Places a title heading above the panel.

option.name: ExpandCollapse
option.description: Place an 'Expand and Collapse Toggle' button on the panel.

option.name: ColumnHeadings
option.description: Adds a field label for each field value (for Classic Page Styles, labels are always above the table grid. Modern labels can be either inside or above).

option.name: PaginationControl
option.description: Places pagination control on the panel.

option.name: PageSize
option.description: The number of rows displayed on-screen at one time in a Table panel. Use the Pagination control to move from page to page. Use the PageSize pass-through attribute in the Properties dialog to set individual controls.

option.name: PanelStyle
option.description: Enable scrolling in the data grid portion of the panel.

option.name: ColumnSorting
option.description: Enable column sorting for all appropriate columns in the panel.

option.name: LinkForeignKey
option.displayname: Automatically link foreign key field to
option.description: Creates hypertext links for foreign key fields in the panel. Allows users to click through to the underlying record.

option.name: HideDataUntilSearched
option.description: Initially hides data display. Displays data when user clicks 'Go'. Use the HideDataUntilSearched pass-through attribute in the Properties dialog to set individual controls.

option.name: InitialRowDisplayStyle
option.description: Specifies the initial panel layout when the page is first displayed. Use the InitialRowDisplay pass-through attribute in the Properties dialog to set individual controls.

option.name: RowDisplayAction
option.description: Specifies how to handle expanding and collapsing table rows when the �Expand� button is clicked. Use the RowDisplayAction pass-through attribute in the Properties dialog to set individual controls.

optionitem.displayname: Expand selected row and collapse other rows

optiongroup.name: ChartsConfiguration
optiongroup.description: These settings govern the Charts visualization

option.name: UsePalette
option.description: Use multicolor palette for Bar, Column or Line chart. Palette is always used for a Pie chart.

option.name: CustomProperties
option.description: Add custom properties for the charts. For a list of properties search the internet for "Custom properties for charts"

optiongroup.name: Title
optiongroup.description: Specifies the Title settings for the charts.

option.name: ShowTitle
option.description: Indicates whether to show chart title.

option.name: ShowXAxisTitle
option.description: Indicates whether to show X-Axis title. Not applicable for Pie chart.

option.name: ShowYAxisTitle
option.description: Indicates whether to show Y-Axis title.

optiongroup.name: Display
optiongroup.description: Indicates properties to display data values on bars or lines.

option.name: DisplayDataValuesOnChart
option.description: Indicates whether to display data values on bars or lines. Not applicable for Pie charts.

option.name: IncludeRemainder
option.description: Indicates whether to display "others" value for records not included in Top X.

option.name: ShowValuesAs
option.description: Indicates numeric display format.

option.name: SortValues
option.description: Indicates how to sort displayed values.

optiongroup.name: Label
optiongroup.description: Indicates display properties of the labels for the chart

option.name: XAxisLabelOrientation
option.description: Indicates display orientation of X-axis labels. 0 angle means horizontal label, -90 angle means vertical, -50 angle means diagonal

option.name: ShowInsideChart
option.description: Indicates what to show inside chart: index labels inside bars or values at bar end or nothing. Not applicable for Pie or Line charts.

optiongroup.name: InsideRepeater
optiongroup.description: Specifies settings for charts present inside table rows.

option.name: InsideRepeaterHeight
option.description: Specifies the height of the chart image in pixels inside table rows.

option.name: InsideRepeaterWidth
option.description: Specifies the width of the chart image in pixels inside table rows.

optiongroup.name: OutsideRepeater
optiongroup.description: Specifies settings for charts present outside table rows.

option.name: OutsideRepeaterHeight
option.description: Specifies the height of the chart image in pixels outside table rows.

option.name: OutsideRepeaterWidth
option.description: Specifies the width of the chart image in pixels outside table rows.

option.name: MaxNameWidth
option.description: Specifies the maximum number of characters before menu, table, and field names are shortened.

option.name: GenerateQuickSelector
option.description: Specifies control type for filters and foreign key selectors.

option.description: Specifies control type for sort control. DropDownList applies to Modern Page Style only.

option.description: Specifies database fields to be excluded when creating new pages separated by commas. (Note: Excluding required fields and primary key fields is not recommended.)

optiongroup.name: MasterPages
optiongroup.description: Options controlling master page creation.

option.name: ContentPlaceHolderID
option.description: Specify the master page identifier to use in generated pages. Be sure your default master page also uses this value for its contentplaceholder. If changed modify ApplicationWebForm.js

option.name: ContentPlaceHolderId_PlaceHolderPageTitle
option.displayname: SharePoint Page Title Content Placeholder ID
option.description: Specify the page title content identifier to use in generated pages. Be sure your default master page also uses this value for its page title placeholder.

option.name: ContentPlaceHolderId_PlaceHolderMain
option.description: Specify the main content identifier to use in generated pages. Be sure your default master page also uses this value for its main content placeholder. If changed modify ApplicationWebForm.js.

option.name: UseSharePointDefaultMasterPage
option.displayname: SharePoint Use Microsoft SharePoint default master page
option.description: Use the Microsoft SharePoint default master page as your pages' master page.

option.name: DefaultTopLevelMasterPage
option.displayname: SharePoint Web Default top-level master page
option.description: Specifies the master page to use for your pages.

option.name: DefaultTopLevelMasterPageMobile
option.displayname: SharePoint Mobile Default top-level master page
option.description: Specifies the master page to use for your mobile pages.

option.name: AddScriptManager
option.displayname: SharePoint 2010: Add ScriptManager reference to master page
option.description: Add a reference to ScriptManager to all low level Master Pages (i.e HorizontalMenu, VerticalMenu, Email, Print, etc.) for Microsoft SharePoint 2010 application.

optiongroup.name: GeneralAppOptions
optiongroup.description: These options apply globally to your application and take effect when you next rebuild your application.

optiongroup.name: WebPageOptions
optiongroup.description: These options apply to the pages when you next rebuild your application.

optiongroup.name: PageHeader
optiongroup.description: Add these controls to the page header.

option.name: SkipNavigationLink
option.displayname: Add 'Skip Navigation Links' link at top of page for Section 508 Compliance
option.description: Allow users to skip over repetitive navigation links by clicking on a 'Skip Navigation Links' link at the top of the page.

optiongroup.name: UpperToolBar
optiongroup.description: Add these controls to the upper right corner of pages.

option.name: SelectTheme
option.displayname: Add a 'Select Theme' dropdown list to the page header
option.description: Places a 'Select Theme' dropdown list in the page header area for multicolor themes. Allows users to select the color scheme of the page.

option.name: SetLanguageButton
option.displayname: Add a 'Select Language' dropdown list to the page header
option.description: Places a 'Select Language' dropdown list in the page header area for multi-lingual applications. Allows users to select the language of the web page.

option.name: SignInButton
option.displayname: Add a 'Sign In' button and link to the page header
option.description: Places a 'SignIn'/'SignOut' button and link in the page header area. Allows users to sign in and sign out.

option.name: ShowSignInStatus
option.description: Displays user sign-in status at the top of the page when security is enabled.

option.name: PrintPageButton
option.displayname: Add a Classic 'Print Page' button to the page header
option.description: Places a 'Print Page' button in the page header area. Allows users to print the web page. Applies to Classic Page Styles only.

optiongroup.name: PageControls
optiongroup.description: These settings govern the generation and display of various page controls.

option.name: CalendarControl
option.displayname: Add calendar control for date fields
option.description: Generate date selectors adjacent to date input fields.

option.name: IncrementDecrementButton
option.description: Add increment and decrement buttons for date, number and currency fields. Use the EnableIncrementDecrementButtons property in the Properties dialog to set individual controls.

option.name: MaximumListBoxSize
option.description: The maximum number of items to place in a list box at application run-time. Use the MaxGeneratedItems property in the Properties dialog to set individual controls.

option.name: SmoothPanelUpdate
option.description: Enables the Ajax-based smooth panel update feature. Table and Record panels update independently and without postback flicker. Use the SmoothPanelUpdate property in the Properties dialog to set individual controls.

optiongroup.name: MaximumImageSize
optiongroup.description: These settings governs the maximum width of the image, inside and outside tables rows

option.name: InsideRepeater
option.description: Specifies the width of the image in pixels inside table rows.

option.name: OutsideRepeater
option.description: Specifies the width of the image in pixels outside table rows.

option.name: InsideGalleryRepeater
option.description: Specifies the width of the image in pixels inside gallery. Not applicable for Gallery with Overlaid Text

optiongroup.name: PopupTextControls
optiongroup.description: These settings govern the generation and display of pop-up controls for large text fields.

option.name: DisplayPopupForStringField
option.description: Display a pop-up when the application user mouses over large text fields. The text in the individual field must exceeds the Minimum pop-up threshold. Use the PopupDisplay property in the Properties dialog to set individual controls.

option.name: DisplayPopupThreshold
option.displayname: Display pop-up when text exceeds (# chars)
option.description: Display a pop-up for large text fields if the string length exceeds this value. Use the PopupThreshold property in the Properties dialog to set individual controls.

optiongroup.name: PopupImageControls
optiongroup.description: These settings govern the generation and display of pop-up controls for image fields.

option.name: ImageFieldPopup
option.description: Display a pop-up when the application user mouses over image fields. Use the PopupDisplay property in the Properties dialog to set individual controls.

option.name: ThumbnailSize
option.description: Scale images displayed on underlying web pages to a percentage (0 to 100%) of their actual size. Use the ImagePercentSize property in the Properties dialog to set individual controls.

optiongroup.name: RichTextEditorControls
optiongroup.description: These settings govern the use of rich text editor controls.

option.name: RichTextEditorThreshold
option.displayname: Threshold for rich text editor (# chars)
option.description: Use the rich text editor for fields larger than this value.

option.name: RichTextEditor
option.description: Specifies the rich text editor to use for fields larger than the threshold. Use the Rich Text Editor Type property in the Properties dialog to set individual controls. Certain options may require a third-party product license and DLL.

optiongroup.name: RTERecordControls
optiongroup.description: Controls rich text editor settings when used within record panels.

option.name: Width
option.description: Specifies the width of the rich text editor window in pixels. Use the RichTextEditorWidth property in the Properties dialog to set individual controls.

option.name: Height
option.description: Specifies the height of the rich text editor window in pixels. Use the RichTextEditorHeight property in the Properties dialog to set individual controls.

optiongroup.name: RTETableControlsLabelsInRepeater
optiongroup.description: Controls rich text editor settings when used within table panels. Applies to Modern Page Styles with field labels Inside Table Rows.

option.name: Width
option.description: Specifies the width of the rich text editor window in pixels. Use the RichTextEditorWidth property in the Properties dialog to set individual controls.

option.name: Height
option.description: Specifies the height of the rich text editor window in pixels. Use the RichTextEditorHeight property in the Properties dialog to set individual controls.

optiongroup.name: RTETableControls
optiongroup.description: Controls rich text editor settings when used within table panels. Applies to Classic Page Styles and Modern Page Styles with field labels Above Column.

option.name: Width
option.description: Specifies the width of the rich text editor window in pixels. Use the RichTextEditorWidth property in the Properties dialog to set individual controls.

option.name: Height
option.description: Specifies the height of the rich text editor window in pixels. Use the RichTextEditorHeight property in the Properties dialog to set individual controls.

optiongroup.name: ExportThreshold
optiongroup.description: These settings govern the maximum Microsoft Excel or CSV rows that can be exported.

option.name: ThresholdValue
option.description: Specifies the maximum Microsoft Excel rows that can be exported. Larger files will be exported as ASCII CSV without resolving foreign key references. Applies to Excel and CSV Export Only.

optiongroup.name: MobilePageOptions
optiongroup.description: These options apply to pages when you next rebuild your application.

optiongroup.name: PageHeader
optiongroup.description: Add these controls to the StartMobile page header.

option.description: Places a 'Select Theme' dropdown list in the StartMobile page header area for multicolor themes. Allows users to select the color scheme of the page.

option.displayname: Add a 'Select Language' dropdown list to the StartMobile page header
option.description: Places a 'Select Language' dropdown list in the StartMobile page header area for multi-lingual applications. Allows users to select the language of the page.

option.name: PrintPageButton
option.displayname: Add a 'Print Page' button to the web page header
option.description: Places a 'Print Page' button in the web page header area. Allows users to print the web page. (Web Page only.)

option.name: SignInButton
option.displayname: Add a 'Sign In' button and link to the StartMobile page header
option.description: Places a 'SignIn'/'SignOut' button and link in the StartMobile page header area. Allows users to sign in and sign out.

option.name: ShowSignInStatus
option.description: Displays user sign-in status at the top of the StartMobile page header area when security is enabled.

option.name: ThumbnailSize
option.description: Scale images displayed on underlying mobile pages to a percentage (0 to 100%) of their actual size. Use the ImagePercentSize property in the Properties dialog to set individual controls.

option.name: RichTextEditor

optiongroup.name: SignInPage
optiongroup.description: These settings govern the generation and display of controls on the Sign-In page.

option.name: RememberUserCheckbox
option.description: Places a 'Remember User' option next to the User Name field in the Sign-In panel.

option.name: RememberPasswordCheckbox
option.description: Places a 'Remember Password' option next to the Password field in the Sign-In panel.

option.name: SignInCheckBox
option.description: Places an 'Automatically Sign-in' option in the Sign-In panel.

optiongroup.name: ChartsConfiguration
optiongroup.description: These settings govern the Charts visualization

option.name: Color
option.description: Specifies color used to render Column, Bar or Line chart if 'Use palette' property is set to No. For the list of colors search the internet for ".NET Color Members"

option.name: GridColor
option.description: Specifies the color of the chart grid lines. For the list of colors search the internet for ".NET Color Members"

option.name: BackgroundColor
option.description: Specifies background color of the Chart. For the list of colors search the internet for ".NET Color Members"

option.name: ColorPalette
option.description: Specifies palette to be used for the chart

optiongroup.name: Fonts
optiongroup.description: Fonts properties for the Chart Control

option.name: FontType
option.description: Specifies font type of the text for the Chart

optionitem.value: Gill Sans MT Ext Condensed Bold
optionitem.displayname: Gill Sans MT Ext Condensed Bold

optionitem.value: Tw Cen MT Condensed Extra Bold
optionitem.displayname: Tw Cen MT Condensed Extra Bold

option.name: FontColor
option.description: Specifies text font color of the Chart. For the list of colors search the internet for ".NET Color Members"

optiongroup.name: TextControls
optiongroup.description: These settings govern the generation and display of pop-up controls for large text fields.

option.name: DisplayTextAs
option.description: Display the field content as HTML source or rich text. Use the HTMLEncodeValue property in the Properties dialog to set individual controls.

option.name: RichTextThreshold
option.displayname: Threshold to display rich text (# chars)
option.description: Display the field content as rich text when fields are larger than this value.

option.name: LimitTextOnPage
option.displayname: Limit text on page to (# chars)
option.description: Limits the number of text characters displayed for the field. Use the FieldMaxLength property in the Properties dialog to set individual controls.

optiongroup.name: QuickSelectors
optiongroup.description: These settings govern the generation of quick selectors.

option.name: FieldMaxLength
option.displayname: Limit text on quick selector control to (# chars)
option.description: Limits the number of text characters displayed for the field. Use the FieldMaxLength property in the Properties dialog to set individual controls. To limit the text characters on the quick selector's pop-up, please modify ".QSttc div" in the style sheet.

optiongroup.name: MobileTextControls
optiongroup.description: These settings govern the generation and display of pop-up controls for large text fields.

option.name: LimitTextOnPage
option.displayname: Limit text on page to (# chars)
option.description: Limits the number of text characters displayed for the field. Use the FieldMaxLength property in the Properties dialog to set individual controls.

optiongroup.name: SearchControls
optiongroup.description: These settings govern the generation and display of search controls.

option.name: AutoTypeahead
option.description: Display a list of possible results as the user types. Use the AutoTypeAhead property in the Properties dialog to set individual controls.

option.name: SearchFor
option.description: Specifies text matching criteria to compliment the database search operator. Use the AutoTypeAheadSearch property in the Properties dialog to set individual controls.

option.name: DisplayMatchedText
option.description: Specifies where to display the matched text in the surrounding string. Use the AutoTypeAheadDisplayFoundText property in the Properties dialog to set individual controls.

option.name: TypeaheadDelay
option.displayname: Type-ahead delay before retrieving suggestion list (milliseconds)
option.description: Retrieve suggestion list after this length of time. Use the AutoTypeAheadDelay property in the Properties dialog to set individual controls.

option.name: MinimumCharacter
option.description: Minimum number of characters that must be entered before the suggestion list is displayed. Use the AutoTypeAheadMinChars property in the Properties dialog to set individual controls.

option.name: SuggestionListSize
option.description: Maximum number of suggestions displayed in the type-ahead suggestion list. Use the AutoTypeAhead property in the Properties dialog to set individual controls. Use the AutoTypeAheadListSize property in the Properties dialog to set individual controls.

option.name: WordSeparationCharacters
option.description: Specifies the characters that indicate word breaks using a regular expression. Use the AutoTypeAheadWordSeparators property in the Properties dialog to set individual controls.

optiongroup.name: Security
optiongroup.description: These settings govern the application security.

option.name: EncryptURL
option.description: Encrypts URL parameters so that database primary key values are not visible.

optiongroup.name: ROICalculation
optiongroup.description: These settings govern the ROI calculations (Trial Edition only)

option.name: ROIHourlyRate
option.description: The hourly rate (in $) used for the ROI calculations. Results are presented using the English culture.

option.name: ROICodePageHours
option.displayname: Hours to construct a code file
option.description: The average number of hours needed to construct a code file in an application. Used for the ROI calculations.

option.name: ROIAspxPageHours
option.displayname: Hours to construct an ASPX page
option.description: The average number of hours needed to construct an ASPX page in an application. Used for the ROI calculations.

optiongroup.name: Geolocation
optiongroup.description: These settings control browser location functionality.

option.name: BrowserLocation
option.description: Requests latitude, longitude, etc. of web browser used to access application.

optiongroup.name: AndroidAppProperties
optiongroup.description: These settings govern the Android application properties.

option.name: AndroidAppName
option.description: Android application name. It cannot contain special characters and should start with an alphabet and can contain 6 to 20 characters.

option.name: BackgroundColor
option.description: Android application header background color.

option.name: MessageNoInternet
option.value: You need internet connectivity to access this application. Check your internet connection.
option.defaultvalue: You need internet connectivity to access this application. Check your internet connection.
option.description: Message displayed when internet connection is not available.

option.name: UserLocation
option.description: States whether to display user location.

option.name: VersionName
option.description: A string value that represents the release version of the application code, as it should be shown to users.

option.name: VersionCode
option.description: An integer value that represents the version of the application code, relative to other versions.

option.name: TargetSDKVersion
option.description: An integer designating the API level that the application targets. E.g. values like 17 or 18 or 19.

optiongroup.name: AndroidAppIcon
optiongroup.description: Governs application icon displayed when application is installed on an android device.

option.name: AppIconMedium
option.description: Icon for medium-density (on traditional HVGA) screens; approximately 160dpi.(48x48)

option.name: AppIconHighDensity
option.description: Icon for high-density screens; approximately 240dpi. (72x72)

option.name: AppIconExtraHighDensity
option.description: Icon for extra high-density screens; approximately 320dpi. (96x96)

option.name: AppIconExtraExtraHighDensity
option.description: Icon for extra high-density screens; approximately 480dpi. (144x144)

option.name: AppIconExtraExtraExtraHighDensity
option.description: Icon for extra high-density screens; approximately 640dpi. (192x192)

optiongroup.name: AndroidLogo
optiongroup.description: Application logo is displayed on the top left corner of every page.

option.name: AppLogoMedium
option.description: Logo for medium-density (on traditional HVGA) screens; approximately 160dpi. (48x48)

option.name: AppLogoHighDensity
option.description: Logo for high-density screens; approximately 240dpi. (72x72)

option.name: AppLogoExtraHighDensity
option.description: Logo for extra high-density screens; approximately 320dpi. (96x96)

option.name: AppLogoExtraExtraHighDensity
option.description: Logo for extra high-density screens; approximately 480dpi. (144x144)

option.name: AppLogoExtraExtraExtraHighDensity
option.description: Logo for extra high-density screens; approximately 640dpi. (192x192)

optiongroup.name: AndroidKeyGenerationOptions
optiongroup.description: Governs properties required to generate a public/private key pair.

option.name: Password
option.description: Specifies the password required to access the keystore. Minimum password length should be 6 characters. It must start with alphanumeric character and can contain 6 to 20 characters.

option.name: KeyAlias
option.description: Specifies the alias for the public-private key pair. An alias is a character string that identifies the public-private key pair within the keystore. It must start with alphanumeric character and can contain 6 to 20 characters.

option.name: KeyValidity
option.description: Specifies the validity of the key in number of days. It should be in the range of 365 and 50000.

option.name: CommonName
option.description: Common name of the certificate owner. It cannot contain special characters except period and space. It can have 2 to 50 characters.

option.name: OrganizationUnit
option.description: Organizational unit of the certificate owner. It cannot contain special characters except period and space. It can have 2 to 50 characters.

option.name: OrganizationName
option.description: Organization to which the certificate owner belongs. It cannot contain special characters except period and space. It can have 2 to 50 characters.

option.name: LocalityName
option.description: City name of the certificate owner. It cannot contain special characters except period and space. It can have 2 to 50 characters.

option.name: StateName
option.description: State or province of the certificate owner. It cannot contain special characters except period and space. It can have 2 to 50 characters.

option.name: CountryCode
option.description: Country of the certificate owner. It cannot contain special characters except period and space. It can have 2 to 50 characters.
